briefTitle: Effect of Colchicine on the Incidence of Atrial Fibrillation in Open Heart Surgery Patients

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* All consecutive adult patients undergoing elective cardiac surgery

Exclusion Criteria:

* Documented history of AF or supraventricular arrhythmia or, absence of sinus rhythm on hospital admission
* Known severe liver disease or current transaminases \>1.5 times the upper normal limit
* Current serum creatinine \>2.5 mg/dl
* Known myopathy or elevated baseline preoperative creatine kinase
* Known blood dyscrasias
* Significant gastrointestinal disease
* Pregnant and lactating women
* Known hypersensitivity to colchicine
* Current treatment with colchicine for any indications
* Emergency surgery

outcomeMeasures.title: The Number of Participants With Atrial Fibrillation
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary efficacy end point was the rate of AF in both arms. AF lasting more than 5 minutes were considered significant

outcomeMeasures.title: The Number of Participants With Colchicine Side Effects
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary safety endpoint was the occurrence of side effects. Side effects monitored were mainly gastrointestinal effects (especially diarrhoea), alopecia, anorexia, hepatotoxicity, myotoxicity, and bone marrow toxicity.
